text.eng: XX.— A DISTINCTION WITHOUT A DIFFERENCE.

89.— Alexander, the king of Macedonia, questioned a captured thief with these words: 'By what right do you attack the sea?' The thief, fearing nothing, replied: 'You and I use the same right; yet I have a single small ship; therefore I am called a thief: but you command great fleets and armies; thus you are called a conqueror.'
text.lat: 89.— Alexander, Macedoniae rex, latronem captum his verbis interrogavit: ‘Quo tandem iure mare lacessis?’ Latro nihil timens respondit: ‘Ego et tu eodem iure utimur; unam autem parvam navem habeo; latro igitur vocor: tu autem magnis classibus et exercitibus praees; itaque victor vocaris.’
